definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: But when you create thousands of small tables, the combined overhead can be significant.
sentences.chinese: 但是当你创建数千个小表时，总的开销就非常大了。

sentences.english: You spend one-second of the monthly expense on body-building .
sentences.chinese: 你将月开销的二分之一用于健身运动。

sentences.english: All expenses have been paid up.
sentences.chinese: 一切费用都已经开销了。

sentences.english: The elapsed time overhead, expressed as a percentage, is shown by the yellow line.
sentences.chinese: 时间开销用百分比表达，显示为黄线。

sentences.english: This frugality is starting to show up in overall wedding costs.
sentences.chinese: 新人们在整场婚礼的开销上也开始节俭起来了。

sentences.english: She joined a nearby food  cooperative to slash her bill.
sentences.chinese: 她加入了附近的一个食品合作社，以便减少食品开销。

sentences.english: This offloads the overhead of taking a backup on the production database.
sentences.chinese: 这样就减少了在生产数据库上做备份的开销。

sentences.english: He'd rather economize on clothes and food than travel.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿俭衣节食，而不愿节省旅游开销。

sentences.english: How much do you spend on entertainment per-month?
sentences.chinese: 每个月在娱乐活动方面有多少开销呢？

sentences.english: The city council brought down the new spending plans yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天市参议会正式公布了新的经费开销计划。

sentences.english: Serialization overhead for the out-of-process call.
sentences.chinese: 进程外调用的序列化开销。

sentences.english: In-Frame level parallelism has the greatest load balance, but more communication overhead.
sentences.chinese: 图像帧内并行的负载最为平衡，但通信开销较大。

sentences.english: In order to reduce this overhead, a connection pool can run validation while it is idle.
sentences.chinese: 为了减少此类开销，连接池在空闲时会运行该验证。

sentences.english: Beware of little Expences, a small Leak will sink a great Ship.
sentences.chinese: 留意小开销，再大的船也可能因为小小的裂缝就沉掉。

sentences.english: I think they padded the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们浮报了开销。

sentences.english: This will print out timing information to the terminal that executed the client script.
sentences.chinese: 这将把时间开销信息打印到执行了客户机脚本的终端。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
